declarations.comments:
Interface describing a key. Use the `unsafeFromKey` to convert a key
to a known type (e.g if you only strings as keys, or perfectly knows the
type of a given key).
declarations.title: IDBKey

modules.name: Database.IndexedDB.Core
modules.comments:
The Core module gathers types used across the library and provides basic Show instances for
those types.

NOTE:
Errors normally thrown by the IDB* interfaces are wrapped in the `Aff` Monad as `Error`
where the `message` corresponds to the error's name (e.g. "InvalidStateError").
Pattern matching can therefore be done on any error message to handle specific errors thrown
by the API.

declarations.comments: IDB Effects, manifestation that something happened with the IndexedDB
declarations.title: IDB

declarations.comments:
A cursor has a direction that determines whether it moves in monotonically
increasing or decreasing order of the record keys when iterated, and if it
skips duplicated values when iterating indexes.
The direction of a cursor also determines if the cursor initial position is at
the start of its source or at its end.
declarations.title: CursorDirection

declarations.comments:
If the source of a cursor is an object store, the effective object store of
the cursor is that object store and the effective key of the cursor is the
cursor’s position. If the source of a cursor is an index, the effective object
store of the cursor is that index’s referenced object store and the effective key
is the cursor’s object store position.
declarations.title: CursorSource

declarations.comments:
A transaction has a mode that determines which types of interactions can be performed
upon that transaction. The mode is set when the transaction is created and remains
fixed for the life of the transaction.
declarations.title: TransactionMode

declarations.comments:
A key path is a list of strings that defines how to extract a key from a value.
A valid key path is one of:

- An empty list.
- An singleton identifier, which is a string matching the IdentifierName production from the ECMAScript Language Specification [ECMA-262].
- A singleton string consisting of two or more identifiers separated by periods (U+002E FULL STOP).
- A non-empty list containing only strings conforming to the above requirements.
declarations.title: KeyPath

declarations.comments:
Each origin has an associated set of databases. A database has zero or more object
stores which hold the data stored in the database.
declarations.title: Database

declarations.comments:
An index allows looking up records in an object store using properties of the values
in the object stores records.
declarations.title: Index

declarations.comments:
A cursor is used to iterate over a range of records in an index or an object store
in a specific direction. A KeyCursor doesn't hold any value.
declarations.title: KeyCursor

declarations.comments: A key range is a continuous interval over some data type used for keys.
declarations.title: KeyRange

declarations.comments: An object store is the primary storage mechanism for storing data in a database.
declarations.title: ObjectStore

declarations.comments:
A Transaction is used to interact with the data in a database.
Whenever data is read or written to the database it is done by using a transaction.
declarations.title: Transaction

declarations.comments:
A cursor is used to iterate over a range of records in an index or an object store
in a specific direction. A ValueCursor also holds the value corresponding to matching key.
declarations.title: ValueCursor

declarations.comments: FromString represents enumerations that can be represented as Strings.
declarations.title: FromString

modules.name: Database.IndexedDB.IDBCursor
modules.comments:
A cursor is used to iterate over a range of records in an index or
an object store in a specific direction.

declarations.comments:
Cursor objects implement the IDBCursor interface.
There is only ever one IDBCursor instance representing a given cursor.
There is no limit on how many cursors can be used at the same time.
declarations.title: IDBCursor

declarations.comments: Returns the direction (Next|NextUnique|Prev|PrevUnique) of the cursor.
declarations.title: direction'

declarations.comments:
Returns the key of the cursor. Throws a "InvalidStateError" DOMException
if the cursor is advancing or is finished.
declarations.title: key'

declarations.comments:
Returns the effective key of the cursor. Throws a "InvalidStateError" DOMException
if the cursor is advancing or is finished.
declarations.title: primaryKey'

declarations.comments: Returns the IDBObjectStore or IDBIndex the cursor was opened from.
declarations.title: source'

declarations.comments: Returns the direction (Next|NextUnique|Prev|PrevUnique) of the cursor.
declarations.title: direction

declarations.comments:
Returns the key of the cursor. Throws a "InvalidStateError" DOMException
if the cursor is advancing or is finished.
declarations.title: key

declarations.comments:
Returns the effective key of the cursor. Throws a "InvalidStateError" DOMException
if the cursor is advancing or is finished.
declarations.title: primaryKey

declarations.comments: Returns the IDBObjectStore or IDBIndex the cursor was opened from.
declarations.title: source

modules.name: Database.IndexedDB.IDBDatabase
modules.comments:
Each origin has an associated set of databases. A database has zero or more object
stores which hold the data stored in the database.

declarations.comments: The IDBDatabase interface represents a connection to a database.
declarations.title: IDBDatabase

declarations.comments: Type alias for StoreName
declarations.title: StoreName

declarations.comments: Returns the name of the database.
declarations.title: name

declarations.comments: Returns a list of the names of object stores in the database.
declarations.title: objectStoreNames

declarations.comments: Returns the version of the database.
declarations.title: version

declarations.comments: Event handler for the `abort` event.
declarations.title: onAbort

declarations.comments: Event handler for the `close` event.
declarations.title: onClose

declarations.comments: Event handler for the `error` event.
declarations.title: onError

declarations.comments: Event handler for the `versionchange` event.
declarations.title: onVersionChange

modules.name: Database.IndexedDB.IDBFactory
modules.comments:
Database objects are accessed through methods on the IDBFactory interface.
A single object implementing this interface is present in the global scope
of environments that support Indexed DB operations.

declarations.comments: Type alias for DatabaseName.
declarations.title: DatabaseName

declarations.comments: Type alias for Version.
declarations.title: Version

declarations.comments:
Attempts to delete the named database. If the database already exists
and there are open connections that don’t close in response to a
`versionchange` event, the request will be blocked until all they close.
declarations.title: deleteDatabase

declarations.comments:
Attempts to open a connection to the named database with the specified version.
If the database already exists with a lower version and there are open connections
that don’t close in response to a versionchange event, the request will be blocked
until all they close, then an upgrade will occur. If the database already exists with
a higher version the request will fail.

When the version isn't provided (`Nothing`), attempts to open a connection to the
named database with the current version, or 1 if it does not already exist.
declarations.title: open

declarations.comments:
Flags to set on the index.

An index has a `unique` flag. When this flag is set, the index enforces that no
two records in the index has the same key. If a record in the index’s referenced
object store is attempted to be inserted or modified such that evaluating the index’s
key path on the records new value yields a result which already exists in the index,
then the attempted modification to the object store fails.

An index has a `multiEntry` flag. This flag affects how the index behaves when the
result of evaluating the index’s key path yields an array key. If the `multiEntry` flag
is unset, then a single record whose key is an array key is added to the index.
If the `multiEntry` flag is true, then the one record is added to the index for each
of the subkeys.
declarations.title: IDBIndexParameters

declarations.comments:
The IDBIndex interface represents an index handle.
Any of these methods throw an "TransactionInactiveError" DOMException
if called when the transaction is not active.
declarations.title: IDBIndex

declarations.comments: Returns true if the index's unique flag is set.
declarations.title: unique

declarations.comments: Returns the IDBObjectStore the index belongs to.
declarations.title: objectStore

declarations.comments: Returns the name of the index.
declarations.title: name

declarations.comments: Returns true if the index's multiEntry flag is set.
declarations.title: multiEntry

declarations.comments: Returns the key path of the index.
declarations.title: keyPath

modules.name: Database.IndexedDB.IDBIndex
modules.comments:
An index allows looking up records in an object store using properties of the values
in the object stores records.

modules.name: Database.IndexedDB.IDBIndex.Internal
modules.comments:
An index allows looking up records in an object store using properties of the values
in the object stores records.

declarations.comments:
The IDBIndex interface represents an index handle.
Any of these methods throw an "TransactionInactiveError" DOMException
if called when the transaction is not active.
declarations.title: IDBIndex

declarations.comments:
Flags to set on the index.

An index has a `unique` flag. When this flag is set, the index enforces that no
two records in the index has the same key. If a record in the index’s referenced
object store is attempted to be inserted or modified such that evaluating the index’s
key path on the records new value yields a result which already exists in the index,
then the attempted modification to the object store fails.

An index has a `multiEntry` flag. This flag affects how the index behaves when the
result of evaluating the index’s key path yields an array key. If the `multiEntry` flag
is unset, then a single record whose key is an array key is added to the index.
If the `multiEntry` flag is true, then the one record is added to the index for each
of the subkeys.
declarations.title: IDBIndexParameters

declarations.comments: Callbacks to manipulate a cursor from an Open*Cursor call
declarations.title: Callbacks

declarations.comments: Returns the key path of the index.
declarations.title: keyPath

declarations.comments: Returns true if the index's multiEntry flag is set.
declarations.title: multiEntry

declarations.comments: Returns the name of the index.
declarations.title: name

declarations.comments: Returns the IDBObjectStore the index belongs to.
declarations.title: objectStore

declarations.comments: Returns true if the index's unique flag is set.
declarations.title: unique

declarations.comments:
Interface describing a key. Use the `unsafeFromKey` to convert a key
to a known type (e.g if you only strings as keys, or perfectly knows the
type of a given key).
declarations.title: IDBKey

modules.name: Database.IndexedDB.IDBKey
modules.comments:
A key has an associated type which is one of: number, date, string, or array.

NOTE: Binary keys aren't supported yet.

modules.name: Database.IndexedDB.IDBKey.Internal
modules.comments:
A key has an associated type which is one of: number, date, string, or array.

NOTE: Binary keys aren't supported yet.

declarations.comments:
Interface describing a key. Use the `unsafeFromKey` to convert a key
to a known type (e.g if you only strings as keys, or perfectly knows the
type of a given key).
declarations.title: IDBKey

modules.name: Database.IndexedDB.IDBKeyRange
modules.comments: A key has an associated type which is one of: number, date, string, binary, or array.

declarations.comments: The IDBKeyRange interface represents a key range.
declarations.title: IDBKeyRange

declarations.comments: Returns a new IDBKeyRange spanning only key.
declarations.title: only

declarations.comments:
Returns a new IDBKeyRange starting at key with no upper bound.
If `Open` is `true`, key is not included in the range.
declarations.title: lowerBound

declarations.comments:
Returns a new IDBKeyRange with no lower bound and ending at key.
If `Open` is `true`, key is not included in the range.
declarations.title: upperBound

declarations.comments:
Returns a new IDBKeyRange spanning from `lower` to `upper`.
If `lowerOpen` is `true`, `lower` is not included in the range.
If `upperOpen` is `true`, `upper` is not included in the range.

It throws a `DataError` if the bound is invalid.
declarations.title: bound

declarations.comments: Returns lower bound if any.
declarations.title: lower

declarations.comments: Returns upper bound if any.
declarations.title: upper

declarations.comments: Returns true if the lower open flag is set, false otherwise.
declarations.title: lowerOpen

declarations.comments: Returns true if the upper open flag is set, false otherwise.
declarations.title: upperOpen

declarations.comments:
Flags to set on the index.

An index has a `unique` flag. When this flag is set, the index enforces that no
two records in the index has the same key. If a record in the index’s referenced
object store is attempted to be inserted or modified such that evaluating the index’s
key path on the records new value yields a result which already exists in the index,
then the attempted modification to the object store fails.

An index has a `multiEntry` flag. This flag affects how the index behaves when the
result of evaluating the index’s key path yields an array key. If the `multiEntry` flag
is unset, then a single record whose key is an array key is added to the index.
If the `multiEntry` flag is true, then the one record is added to the index for each
of the subkeys.
declarations.title: IDBIndexParameters

declarations.comments:
The IDBIndex interface represents an index handle.
Any of these methods throw an "TransactionInactiveError" DOMException
if called when the transaction is not active.
declarations.title: IDBIndex

modules.name: Database.IndexedDB.IDBObjectStore
modules.comments: An object store is the primary storage mechanism for storing data in a database.

declarations.comments: The IDBObjectStore interface represents an object store handle.
declarations.title: IDBObjectStore

declarations.comments: Type alias for IndexName
declarations.title: IndexName

declarations.comments: Options provided when creating an object store.
declarations.title: IDBObjectStoreParameters

declarations.comments: Returns `true` if the store has a key generator, and `false` otherwise.
declarations.title: autoIncrement

declarations.comments: Returns a list of the names of indexes in the store.
declarations.title: indexNames

declarations.comments: Returns the key path of the store, or empty array if none
declarations.title: keyPath

declarations.comments: Returns the name of the store.
declarations.title: name

declarations.comments: Returns the associated transaction.
declarations.title: transaction

modules.name: Database.IndexedDB.IDBTransaction
modules.comments:
A Transaction is used to interact with the data in a database.
Whenever data is read or written to the database it is done by using a transaction.

declarations.comments: The IDBtransaction interface.
declarations.title: IDBTransaction

declarations.comments: If the transaction was aborted, returns the error (a DOMException) providing the reason.
declarations.title: error

declarations.comments:
Returns the mode the transaction was created with (`ReadOnly|ReadWrite`)
, or `VersionChange` for an upgrade transaction.
declarations.title: mode

declarations.comments: Event handler for the `abort` event.
declarations.title: onAbort

declarations.comments: Event handler for the `complete` event.
declarations.title: onComplete

declarations.comments: Event handler for the `error` event.
declarations.title: onError
